rev.diff:
Line 131: Line 131:
Bahawalpur is well connected with various cities in Pakistan. The city has its own airport built by the [[Department of Civil Aviation (Dubai)|Dubai Civil Aviation Department]] and the [[Civil Aviation Authority of Pakistan|CAA]]. [[Bahawalpur Airport]] links the city with various Pakistani cities such as Dera Ghazi Khan, Islamabad, Karachi and Lahore with the national flag carrier, [[Pakistan International Airlines]]. The airline has launched international flights to Dubai, and plans to introduce more international destinations. There are daily train and bus services from Multan, Lahore, Sukkur and Karachi to Bahawalpur.[[taxicabs]] and [[Auto rickshaw|rickshaws]] are plentiful in the city. Cars are also available for hire in the city.
Bahawalpur is well connected with various cities in Pakistan. The city has its own airport built by the [[Department of Civil Aviation (Dubai)|Dubai Civil Aviation Department]] and the [[Civil Aviation Authority of Pakistan|CAA]]. [[Bahawalpur Airport]] links the city with various Pakistani cities such as Dera Ghazi Khan, Islamabad, Karachi and Lahore with the national flag carrier, [[Pakistan International Airlines]]. The airline has launched international flights to Dubai, and plans to introduce more international destinations. There are daily train and bus services from Multan, Lahore, Sukkur and Karachi to Bahawalpur.[[taxicabs]] and [[Auto rickshaw|rickshaws]] are plentiful in the city. Cars are also available for hire in the city.
